en: The ADiSU Umbria regional scholarship supports students with limited financial means, offering cash grants, free dormitories, and subsidized meals.
ğŸ“Œ Eligibility for 2025/2026:
- Enrollment at a university in Umbria (e.g., University of Perugia).
- ISEE below â‚¬27,948.60 and ISPE below â‚¬60,757.87 (see ISEE section).
- Minimum academic credits (CFU): 20 for first year, 40 for second year, 80 for third year (by October 31, 2025).
- Officially translated and certified financial documents (by Italian embassy in Iran).
- Legal residence in Italy (study visa or Permesso di Soggiorno).
ğŸ“‘ Required Documents:
- Copy of passport and study visa or residence permit (Permesso).
- Codice Fiscale (Italian tax code).
- University enrollment certificate (Immatricolazione).
- Financial documents (officially translated):
- Family income statement for 2023 (translated and certified).
- Property deed or rental contract (for ISEE calculation).
- Bank account balance certificate (certified by embassy).
- Scholarship application form (download from ADiSU website: https://www.adisu.umbria.it).
- Academic transcript (for second-year students and above).
ğŸ’° Scholarship Benefits:
- Cash grant: Up to â‚¬5,192 (based on ISEE).
- Free dormitory or rent subsidy (worth â‚¬2,000-3,000/year).
- Subsidized meals at university cafeterias (â‚¬1-3 per meal).
ğŸ”„ Changes from 2024/2025 to 2025/2026:
- ISEE threshold increased from â‚¬26,306.25 to â‚¬27,948.60.
- ISPE threshold increased from â‚¬57,000 to â‚¬60,757.87.
- Minimum CFU for second year raised from 36 to 40 credits.
- Online document submission now available via ADiSU portal (no in-person requirement).
- Application deadline extended from August 31 to September 15, 2025.
âš ï¸ Legal Notes and Warnings:
- Documents must be officially translated to Italian and certified by the Italian embassy.
- Submitting false documents leads to permanent scholarship disqualification and legal penalties.
- Scholarship recipients must reside in Umbria for the academic year.
ğŸ“Œ FAQs:
- Are masterâ€™s students eligible? Yes, if they meet ISEE and CFU requirements.
- What if my ISEE is above the threshold? You may still qualify for subsidized meals or paid dormitories.
- Where to submit documents? Via ADiSU portal or in person at ADiSU office: Via Benedetta, 14, 06123 Perugia.
ğŸ’¡ Tips:
- Prepare documents at least 2 months before the deadline.
- Contact ADiSU (info@adisu.umbria.it) or ESN Perugia for guidance.
- Use the MyUnipg app to track academic credits: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=it.unipg.myunipg
